alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Muscogee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 12:34PM EDT until March 29 at 7:38AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama...Georgia... Chattahoochee River at 14th Street at Columbus affecting Muscogee, Chattahoochee, Russell and Lee Counties. For the Chattahoochee River Basin...including Columbus...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast. * WHERE...Chattahoochee River at 14th Street at Columbus. * WHEN...From this morning to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 31 feet, Minor flooding continues along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the 14th Street bridge. Large portions of the River Walk in Columbus will be completely covered with flowing water up to 4 feet deep. Flood waters approach the maintenance doors underneath the Columbus Convention and Trade Center. The Phenix City Amphitheater in Alabama will be flooded up to 3 feet deep. Portions of the River Walk in Phenix City will be under one foot of water and will be closed to the public. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM CDT Monday /12:15 PM EDT Monday/ the stage was 27.4 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise to 31 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall early tomorrow afternoon. It will once again rise to 30.5 feet tomorrow evening then fall below flood stage by Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 27 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
